capabilities.name: Work Collaboratively
capabilities.description: The role requires working as part of a team to contribute towards conservation efforts, indicating a need for effective collaboration.

capabilities.name: Deliver Results
capabilities.description: Field Officers are expected to assist with a range of activities to maintain and improve park assets, requiring a focus on achieving quality outcomes.

capabilities.name: Plan and Prioritise
capabilities.description: The role involves responding to changing circumstances in park maintenance and conservation, necessitating effective planning and prioritization.

capabilities.name: Think and Solve Problems
capabilities.description: Field Officers must lead operations and solve problems in the field, highlighting the need for practical solution development.

capabilities.name: Display Resilience and Courage
capabilities.description: The physically demanding and outdoor nature of the work requires resilience and the courage to face challenging conditions.

capabilities.name: Act with Integrity
capabilities.description: Given the role's focus on Aboriginal heritage and working with communities, acting with integrity and respect for cultural values is crucial.

capabilities.name: Value Diversity
capabilities.description: The role's requirement for Aboriginal identity and cultural knowledge emphasizes the importance of valuing and respecting diversity.

capabilities.name: Project Management
capabilities.description: Field Officers assist with conservation works and the installation of new assets, requiring basic project management skills.

skills.name: Firefighting
skills.description: Ability to carry out frontline firefighting duties and support roles, including obtaining and maintaining necessary certifications.

skills.name: Equipment Operation
skills.description: Operate and maintain a range of plant and equipment, including conditionally registered vehicles and chainsaws.

skills.name: Cultural Competency
skills.description: Understanding and respecting Aboriginal cultural issues, and the ability to communicate across cultures.

skills.name: Teamwork
skills.description: Work effectively as part of a team, contributing to conservation efforts and park maintenance.

generalRole.name: Conservation and Heritage Field Officer
generalRole.title: Conservation and Heritage Field Officer (Aboriginal Identified)
generalRole.description: This role focuses on the conservation of natural environments and cultural heritage within NSW National Parks, requiring a blend of technical skills, cultural competency, and the ability to work both independently and as part of a team in outdoor settings.
